constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 17 (Thursday, January 28, 2021)]
[House]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Ms. CHENEY:
H.R. 519.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
Article IV, Section 3, Clause 2: ``The Congress shall have
power to dispose of and make all needful rules and
regulations respecting the territory or other property
belonging to the United States; and nothing in this
Constitution shall be so construed as to prejudice any claims
of the United States, or of any particular state.'
[Page H250]

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Energy and Mineral Resources.

title: Safeguarding Oil and Gas Leasing and Permitting Act of 2021
